Reviews.Title: “Nice design and very friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: FrederikHimpe
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel a few days in April 2012, and can only confirm the positive reviews on this site. The hotel location is excellent. The Passeig de Gràcia, hosting some very interesting buildings from Gaudi and others and also a nice shopping street, is just a block away, as are the Avinguda Diagonal, Plaça de Catalunya and the Ramblas. The metro station Diagonal is nearby (when coming from line 3 or line 5, follow the signs in direction of the FGC station (line 6/7), which brings you to the Provença FCG station through some moving walkways and take the exit Balmes: it's just next to the hotel. The original hotel design is very nice. Rooms are very clean and tasteful and the bathrooms are very nice. Every room is equipped with a safe. The free wifi is working reliably in the rooms and every room also has an Internet radio receiver which you can use to listen to radio stations from your home country. It's a nice gadget for this kind of hotel. Also, unlike many other hotels, every room has lots of power sockets for all the gadgets you might already be bringing from home. The breakfast also corresponded with our expectations. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. They have compiled their own list of interesting things to see and do in the city, together with hints about how to get there with public transports, and it also contains restaurant recommendations. Very helpful! As some people already wrote, you can hear metro/train arriving in your room. However I want to say that this is not disturbing at all. It definitely did not prevent us from sleeping. Not all rooms have an exterior window, but this is also something which we did not consider a problem at alll. If you want a nice view, you'd better get out of your room to enjoy the nice city of Barcelona anyway! So we were very happy with our stay here, and would definitely come back here and recommend it to others, especially if you want to try something different than the common, standard hotel design.

Reviews.Title: “Hip yet human”
Reviews.Author: mf2hd
Reviews.Content: This place is a great balance of stylish interiors and friendly, unpretentious service. The whole place is quite pared back and there's good natured-ness in lots of small details that I'll leave for you to discover. It's in a great area of town that's easily accessible on foot or by public transport. Central enough to walk everywhere. Lots of bars and good restaurants close by but never noisy or dodgy at night. Staff that go out of their way to be friendly, helpful and fun to talk to. Free wifi, reasonable price for breakfast, big beds and ok-sized rooms; what more can you ask?

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: kimvanhaalen
Reviews.Content: Staying in hotel Room Mate Emma was a great experience. We were staying in the Suite Atico Deluxe, room 802. Small, clean, modern hotel with great facilities. The staff was very friendly and they paid attention to all details; three minutes after our arrival, one of the receptionists called to our room to check if everything was all right. Also, special attention was paid to the reason of our visit, which made us feel very welcome. One point of attention: our terrace and the terrace of the adjacent room were only separated by several plants, so not too much privacy outside. Furthermore: fast internet, soft sheets, perfect mattress, loved the music system that makes you select your mood (although it stopped functioning the day after our arrival). And last but not least: great location! Thank you for your effort!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: paul b
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay and I would recommed it to anyone. The location is excellent being so close to public transport, La Pedrera & Casa Battlo. There are goods restaurants and bars on the same street and the area feels very safe at night, unlike some of the areas closer to La Ramblas. The staff are really friendly and very attentive. There were some nice little touches that really made you feel welcome. The breakfast buffet is lovely and finishes at midday so you can sleep late unlike most hotels. The rooms are modern, comfortable and surprisingly spacious and the music system is excellent. The only downside is that the underground system runs close by and there is a bit of vibration noise. you'll only notice it at night but some ear plugs or perhaps a room on a higher level will solve this. Don't let that put you off though. I've stayed in a few places in Barcelona and at this price range this is the best.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Benedikt M
Reviews.Content: Great location (close to the center, nice neighborhood), very nice and clean room (only the upgraded rooms have a window though, the cheapest category is in the inside with no external window), friendly and helpful staff. Definitely recommendable!

Reviews.Title: “In the centre of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Filip K
Reviews.Content: Very helpfull, free Wifi, basic but nice breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Can't fault it!!!”
Reviews.Author: aoifeey
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved this hotel. We were here 5 nights. The location is perfect; you're not too close to La Rambla so it is quiet but you are close enough to everything to walk or there are Metro stations close by. The rooms are quite cool and quirky, I especially loved the shower. The place is clean. We didn't get breakfast here so can't comment on that. The one thing that stood out for us was the staff...they couldn't do enough to help. No matter what you asked they are always ready with advice. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone and we hope to stay in other Room Mate hotels on future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Bravo Emma!!”
Reviews.Author: helsbels77
Reviews.Content: Room Mate Emma is a fantastic value hotel. We arrived early, and our room was not yet made up. We were offered the penthouse room as an upgrade, for only a few Euros more, (aroudn £50 extra for 2 nights). We could not have been happier! The penthouse room has a private roof terrace with a large stone raised bath, (amazing for nigh-time bubble baths under the stars!) You can see over the rooftops of Barcelona, and there is a double bed outside for lounging in the sun, or cuddles in the evening. The room is very 'spcae age' in appearance and the bed is extremely comfy. The biggest asset of the hotel are it's staff; they are very helpful and recommended some fantastic restaurants to us; They recommended a local Catalan restaurant to us that was out of this world, (can't remember the name but it's not the Cerveceria Catalunya, it was much more upmarket and well worth a visit!) The only thing that stopped this hotel getting a 5 out of 5 was that the breakfast was rather mediocre, and the Ipod docking system in the room had a light that we couldn't turn off, which created a little unwanted disco at night. All in all this is a brilliant value hotel, and the penthouse is unbelievably good value if you are lucky enough to be able to request the upgrade. Emma is a little gem.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a nice location”
Reviews.Author: RogerRambo
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable and modern room. Easy walk to all the major sites, and nearby metro stops. Excellent breakfasts, and a very kind, warm and helpful staff. Highly recommend it. If there is a room available, book it. Only negative is my room is on the street, and there is lots of traffic. Have gotten used to it after a while, but would have preferred a different location in the hotel. No other rooms were available. Will definitely stay again when I return to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Recommend”
Reviews.Author: Opheliasleeps
Reviews.Content: I wanted to add yet another positive review praising this modern, efficient and friendly hotel in a lovely area of Barcelona. Room rate was very reasonable (£60 B&B per night) and this was a very fair price. The room we stayed in was an excellent size, large window and everything was pristine. Loved the shower! A word of caution, the bed edges are very sharp, and both my partner and myself took souvenir bruises away with us, (ouch) so think this might need some attention. Metro very near by. Thank you to all the charming staff at Room Mate Emma (reception, room service, breakfast staff).

Reviews.Title: “Chic and trendy hotel”
Reviews.Author: JessJensen
Reviews.Content: Nice little chic and trendy hotel at a very good price. Great location close to La Ramblas Catalunya and lots of nice restaurants and bars. If you want a nice bar dont go, because there is none. But who needs a bar in Barcelona. as there as so many bars within a 5 minute walk. Small rooms, but big enough to bring an infant. Staff was absolutely fantastic. Very nice, friendly and helpfull with the little baby. Will diffinately be back.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great property,with a friendly, helpful staff in a great location in an amazing city.”
Reviews.Author: Jmreedy
Reviews.Content: Three of us stayed here for 5 nights at the end of February. We loved practically everything about the hotel. The front desk staff was excellent, always helpful with directions and English skills that far surpassed our Spanish. The breakfast buffet was repetitious but reasonable. The location was perfect as well, easy walking distance to main streets, dining and shopping. The only drawback, and it is minor, is that the very contemporary room design is not conducive to multiple occupants who are on different schedules. The opaque contempo wall treatment between the bedroom and bathroom guarantees that, when one gets up, all get up! Even after we checked out, the staff went over and above to return a power adapter I left in the room. We highly recommend this property!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: 360Traveller360
Reviews.Content: After reading good reviews we thought we would book a "superior" room in this place. We got shown into the tiny, overpoweringly scented room and didn't think it looked very much like a superior room. The foot of the bed was dangerously close to the wall housing the television which was at head height practically causing concussion everytime you needed to walk past. Paintwork was shabby and when we went to take a shower we had to mop up the whole floor as it leaked over the room. When we eventually got to bed the sheets were so threadbare there were holes in them, the mattress was thin enough to feel the springs and the wallmounted radio had led lights flashing constantly, when we couldn't sleep because of the flashing lights and couldn't switch the radio lights off we complained to reception they were obviously aware of this problem and supplied us with an elastoplast to stick over the flashing lights which obviously had no effect. Watch out for the clothes hangers here they have staples sticking out which could ruin your best clothes.Complaining to management got us the offer of a free breakfast (as according to this manager the chain didn't offer refunds,). which we obviosly didn't accept as we couldn't wait to leave the place. Not what we expected from this chain of hotels and especially after paying for the "superior" room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Kvitochka
Reviews.Content: Hotel with nice design concept, very friendly and helpful staff. The location is also very nice, not far from all main sightseeing points (walking distance) as well as very well connected by public transport. Basic but delicious breakfast, free WiFi internet. And I loved radio tuner in the room - touch pannel where you can tune the music depending on your mood :) very tech savvy! The only disappointment was that the room doesn't have "real" window, just to open it for a bit of fresh air. But most probably this is the feature of standard room category only. Overall: everything is very simple, basic and friendly, but what else do you need while exploring Barcelona?

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, super attentive service”
Reviews.Author: MARCO J
Reviews.Content: Location can´t be better, hotel is modern, nice and clean. Staff is helpful and attentive. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Viva Barcelona, Viva Room Mate Emma!”
Reviews.Author: VickyChristinaBCN
Reviews.Content: If you are ever looking for accommodation in a city that has a Room Mate hotel, BOOK IT! We stayed at both Room Mate Alicia in Madrid, and Room Mate Emma in Barcelona, and loved them both to bits. Emma is so centrally and conveniently located, and also in a pleasant neighbourhood. You are a block away from the closest metro station, and a comfortable walk to Las Ramblas. Staff at this hotel are FABULOUS. Our flight from Barcelona to Venice was cancelled, and everything possible was done to make sure we could stay in the same room at the same rate, with as little disturbance to us as possible. They always helped us with any tourist information we required, and the list of recommendations they have at reception is incredibly helpful. The hotel and room itself is in the Room Mate style, funky, modern and faultlessly clean. The breakfast room is wonderful, so many different foods and drinks to choose from. If we ever return to Barcelona, and I hope to the heavens we will, we will be staying here. 10/10!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ccesther
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a business trip. I did not understand why they gave me a disable room even I am not! The bathroom without doors at all, each time after shower, the water will flood your whole room! I mean the whole guest room! When I called them for help, they would just say, the bathroom system is like that, nothing they could do about it! I stayed here for 4 nights and it was a horrible experience! There were no windows in the guests room as they just built another indoor room near the elevator. So it was very noisy and I could hear the elevator sound all the time. Breakfast buffet was not impressive either, I took one orange back to my room after breakfast, then they called me and told me off. I would not choose this hotel or recommend to anyone in my life!

Reviews.Title: “Great and friendly place in nice location”
Reviews.Author: Busby W
Reviews.Content: The people at this hotel were very friendly and knowledable and more than helpful. Great location off the plasa del Gracia...nice breakfast, great recomendations. Rooms small but adequate and clean

Reviews.Title: “Good service”
Reviews.Author: logowesley
Reviews.Content: Every time we go to Spain, we stay in a Room Mate Hotel. All off their hotels have that hip vibe and we are a big fan of their breakfast wich is always served untill noon! I have to admit that the Room Mate hotel in Barcelona was not the nicest one off this hotelgroup. Our room could use a make-over. When we booked this hotel, we were surprised that we had to pay for our breakfast. But afterwards we thought this was a good thing. It was way less bussy in the morning. I guess that not all guest included breakfast. So, breakfast was super relaxed! Service was great! Friendly people and we felt more than welcome. Neighbourhood was oke, but not very happening. Next time in Barcelona I prefer El Borne, but when we are in Madrid or Malaga (or New York or Miami;-))we would definately go back to a Room-Mate Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: diggerati
Reviews.Content: This was the second Room Mate hotel I have stayed at. First I bedded with Alicia in Madrid and then Emma in Barcelona. Emma is definitely the older sister but less quirky. While Alicia had a bit of an exhibitionist streak to her (bathrooms without privacy) Emma was a bit more private but a little tired inside. I had a room that looked onto the roof top of some buildings and a residential courtyard. The room was bigger than the one Alicia offered and funkier inside. The same free wifi in the room which was great. The same toiletries as well. I like the consistency. Even the free cold water at reception for thirsty travelers was a nice touch. Located close to the metro and major shopping streets meant it was a convenient location. All in all a good well priced hotel close to good restaurants and bars. Ask the reception for recommendations. They give you a printout of the top 100 things to do in Barcelona. Do head out to the beach at night and enjoy a good drink and meal at Carpe Diem Lounge. You will love it. Avoid the Ramblas - a crowded tourist trap.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Excellent Staff, Amazing City!!!”
Reviews.Author: El_tiburon84
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from my trip in Barcelona and the only thing that I can say is that i will definitely return back to this city and for sure i will stay again in Room Mate Emma Hotel. The hotel is located in Carrer Rossello Street, 3 squares away from the famous La Pedrera and the metro station of Diagonal. Is a modernistic hotel with amazing rooms!!! The excellent staff that is working in the hotel is a really big asset for them because all of them are really helpful at any time of the day. From the General Manager of the hotel until the room cleaner all of them they are working really hard to meet all the expectations of their guests. A huge THANKS to Oscar!!!! He was really helpful with all the information that he gave to us about the city and the places that we have to visit!!! Georgina and Martya were excellent as well!!!! As I have already mentioned it at the title of my review, I really had a great time in that hotel with excellent staff in the amazing city of Barcelona!!! I hope that i will return back to Room Mate Emma Hotel soon!!!!

Reviews.Title: “great little find”
Reviews.Author: HelenM30
Reviews.Content: We first discovered Room Mate Hotels when we visited Madrid. These are great hotels and they are really modern, central and reasonable. They are pretty low frills but if you are just using this as a base then it's perfect Would definitely recommend and stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and lovely clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: manizzle
Reviews.Content: Went here in September and had a lovely short break. The hotel is a short walk from the subway and is in an area where u will see more locals than tourists. Some lovely pavement cafes and bars serving reasonably priced tapas and snacks. Made to feel very welcome at the hotel and gave some excellent knowledge for food and things to do. They will look after your bags of u get there early so no need to cart everything around the town when u get there!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: marcusjenks
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed here for 4 nights in October in the penthouse suite, we could not have asked for more from the bottle of cava on arrival to the cleanliness of the room everyday. Breakfast was brilliant nice set up for a day in Barcelona. Will definitely stay here again next time we come over.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: Geordie64
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel on the back of some excellent Trip Advisor reviews and I have to say, the place does not disappoint. The room was clean and comfortable and while not having a view out into the street, this did not detract from our experience. The breakfast meal was well presented and everything was fresh. The hotel is ideally placed near to the Metro system and to some great nearby restaurants. If you are stuck on where to go, speak to the reception staff, really friendly and go out of their way to help you, very refreshing. Our utmost thanks go to Georgina and Oscar who were just brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Elisabm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Room Mate Emma for four nights and we were very pleased. First, the location is pretty good: Eixample. A nice neighborhood, many stores and cafes within walking distance. For example, during our stay we only had dinner in nice restaurants near the hotel. To go to further attractions, you just need to walk two blocks to reach the nearest subway station. Second, staff was really willing to help and explained us the best way to move around and gave us tips on restaurants. We had breakfast at the hotel and considered it very good as well. For the price charged - E6.95 per person - we thought it was a good deal. Choices of breads, cheese, juices, pastries etc. Free wi fi in the loby and the room. The reasons why I did not rate this hotel excellent are: (i) the room is very, very dark. The lamps in the room are not enough to make it a clear place. Every morning I needed to open the curtains to get some natural light in order to look for something in my suitcase; (ii) when we took a shower, the water flooded the sink area... Finally, we had a room overlooking the street and that was noisy sometimes. Well, as I said in the title, I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: gmcnally
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a week at the Room Mate Emma in Room 801. Everything about the room was terrific and the best part was the huge terrace overlooking the city. It was very relaxing to come back to the room with a bottle of wine and sit outside on the terrace. The location is accessible to the major sites and also convenient to the metro. The front desk staff was very helpful and provided us with a list of "must sees" in Barcelona which included restaurants. We tried a few of their restaurant recommendations and we were very pleased. We definitely want to visit Barcelona again and will stay at Emma.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: KellyMLnt
Reviews.Content: I am traveling a lot for work so I practically live in hotels. This is one of my favorites! Very modern and clean design, nice rooms, comfortable beds, huge shower (loved it). The hotel staff is very professional, polite and pleasant. The hotel is at a great location, very central, close to a metro station and also close to a lot of cafes, restaurants, stores, and Gaudi attractions. I am definitely going back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: vicgiu
Reviews.Content: Very modern hotel with big bedroom and bathroom. The people at the front desk are professional and friendly. This hotel is well located and close to the metro station. ( only 200 Meters). The breakfast is also good. If you have the choice, just ask for a room with a window... Good deal for a nice time in Barcelona...

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: bigalgiraffe
Reviews.Content: my wife and I stayed from Sunday 18th to Thursday 22nd September we arrived at lunchtime and our room was ready for us ,we were attended to by really helpful staff on reception. We had booked bed and breakfast which was cold buffet with cereals, pastries meats and cheese. We thought the hotel was in a good location near to the subway and within walking distance to the Gaudi attractions on Passeig de Gracia,we also walked to the Sagrada Famillia about half an hour away. There are lots of street cafes and restaurants in the area which we made good use of. We had a great stay and would recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: mejulie0
Reviews.Content: my husband and i stayed in this hotel,we checked trip advisor first for reviews and we were not disappointed.from the minute we checked in the staff could not do enough for you,all the staff were friendly especially Oscar who offered us maps,a list of the top things to see and do even some of his personal favourites which we agreed were worth a visit,a list of restaurants we tried two of them and the food was of good quality,the HABALUC was one of them and the LA BO TIGA food was very good with good choice of wines,prices were very reasonable too for such quality.would highly reccomend.we opted for a deluxe room which is bigger than the others,bathroom excellent, huge bed very comfy after a long tiring day sightseeing.luxurious light fittings,bathroom.quite a space age feel to the hotel ,cant wait to visit room mate emma again,

Reviews.Title: “very new hotel, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: kassnoisette
Reviews.Content: it was difficult to decide wich hotel to get to, it s because t was a new one that we did the room mate, not disapointed at all, everything is almost white and perfectly clean, nice bed, lovely bathroom!! i would defintety recommend it! i m not so sure the location was great , but barcelona is a strange city where there seem to be no proper place to be! the hotel was close from the tube but we did walk to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great service!”
Reviews.Author: TravelKat22
Reviews.Content: Last minute, emergency booking was worth while. The staff was extremly hostile and service oriented. Looking forward staying with them again!

Reviews.Title: “Recommended for quality service!”
Reviews.Author: blackorred
Reviews.Content: 5-star service for a supposedly 3-star hotel! Good location too.

Reviews.Title: “wow amazing hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: phatbear
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 3 night stay at Room Mate Emma, with my better half. The hotel is well located with Diagonal metro station no more than a 5 minute walk away. The check in staff could'nt have been more helpful we arrived on our 1st day a couple of hours before check in time so they suggested they look after our bags so we could go for a wander, which we duly did and sat in the sun for 30mins while they hurried our room along. The room was modern and clean with a comfy bed, a huuuuuge shower, which was amazingly powerful, and a seperate toilet area. Other nice touches were a mini bar with a enough space to store your own bits too. Also amzaing wifi which was always available and fast too, unlike a lot of hotels I have stayed in recently. The area is full of nice little bars and restaurants, along with quite a few coffee shops and because of this we never eat breakfast in the hotel. I struggle to find anthing negative to say about the hotel, however I will try. LIke a previous poster we had a strange flashing blue light on our wall, which was part of the music system, which flashed day and night however I overcame this with the use of a sticker. Thats about it. Next time we are in Barcelona room mate emma WILL be our first choice of accomodation

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel located near la Rambos, metro & great hotels”
Reviews.Author: Bristraveller3870
Reviews.Content: Hotel located few mins from main station, diagonal station (watch your bags & wallets, notorious for pick pokwts, we had no issues).shops, cafes & great places to eat nearby. Check in was very easy, and staff very helpful with suggestions. Oscar at the front desk was very good, along with all staff (can't remember their individual names!). They gave us a list of "100 things to do in Barcelona" a list composed by the hotel. Fantastic. Went to two of the restaurants & they were great value & amazing meals/tapas. Room was quite small but adequate. Bathroom door is opaque glass which is fine but might concern others. There was a random flashing blue light from an old radio in the wall that flashed all night which was annoying. Put a pillow over it & staff said they weren't sure why it was flashing. Breakfast was adequate, lots of selections of juice & different types of milk too. Nice touch leaving notes about what the weather was going to be like the next day, cute! Overall, good location, good service & simple/clean room. Would recommend to travellers if want an easy hotel close to the metro, out of the chaos of Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff and Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Panamaniac06
Reviews.Content: My wife and I love this place! The hotel staff was amazing! They were such great help about any questions we had! If they didn't know it right then, they made sure to get us the info! Hotel is perfect. We stayed in the terrace suite (801) and it was perfect! No complains what so ever! Metro right down the street. Local cafes and resturants right around the corner! Thank you for the great memories!!!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend the Room Mate Emma”
Reviews.Author: Edf1020
Reviews.Content: We stayed in two separate Room Mate hotels in Spain and loved them both. The Emma is in a great location if you want to be in Eixample and near the Passeig de Gracia. It's very easy to navigate Barcelona by metro and there are a couple stops within a few blocks. Our deluxe room was small, but very well laid out and had a juliet balcony facing the street (Carrer de Rocellos). The bathroom was great with a huge shower. Breakfast was included (great selection), as was free Wifi and overall the hotel provided a great value for money. There are probably 100 small restaurants in the area and even in August (when much of Spain shuts down) there were many, many great choices. The thing that stood out at these hotels was the staff. They were so helpful with all our questions and we very much appreciated the great service we received. I've been to Barcelona several times and love this part of town. I would definitely stay at the Room Mate Emma on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bathor
Reviews.Content: + The breakfast buffet: wide range of food and good quality. Cleanliness. - Sometimes, the stylishness is a bit at the expense of functionality (e.g. the lights)

Reviews.Title: “Loved our 3-night stay at Room Mate Emma”
Reviews.Author: JollapParis
Reviews.Content: Lovely personnel at reception for check-in and check-out, very attentive and willing to help. We had a great room on the 8th floor overlooking the backyard, i.e. very quiet. Clean venue. Breakfast was not a strong point, but the cheap price should have been an indicator of what to expect. The vicinity is perfect for visiting the Gaudi houses (La Perdrera & Batllo), and plenty of dining opportunities for all, don't walk miles away to be happy!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Horsecat
Reviews.Content: I'm so pleased that I picked this hotel for our first time in Barcelona! We felt immediately welcomed by the friendly and helpful staff. The rooms were very modern and clean with comfortable beds, free wi fi and a stocked mini bar. We had two comfortable and peaceful nights sleep followed by a decent breakfast. The hotel is in a good location, near Diagonal station and Passeig de Gracia. Plenty of good bars and places to eat and the hotel will give you recommendations. Very sad to leave but will definitely use this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Love Room mate properties”
Reviews.Author: vasudhaM
Reviews.Content: i went around spain for 2 weeks aprrox. almsot in all the cities i visited i stayed in a room mate property. thank god for that. not only are the properties central, staff friendly but the brekka is till noon! Phew. emma was no diffrent. very central it is connected to all the spots by tubes/hop on hop off service that are a minute away.

Reviews.Title: “We love it and recommend it to anyone!”
Reviews.Author: Ioana27
Reviews.Content: - the receptionists speak excellent english and are extremely helpful and very friendly; - the location of the hotel is excellent: close to 2 metro stations and very close to the city center and main attractions, even for a walk; - there are plenty of nice and diverse bars and restaurants around the hotel; - Emma provides recommendations about museums, bars and restaurants and shops in Barcelona and around the hotel itself; - the room was very nicely decorated and very clean; - there is wireless internet in the room and well supplied minibar;

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: mr_mrbaron
Reviews.Content: This is the third Room Mate we have stayed in and we would always choose Room Mate in Madrid and Barcelona. Vey pleasant welcome on arrival and we were roomed immediately wthout having to wait until 2pm. Hotels always tend to be situated in areas near the trendy nightlife but have never had any problem with noise as they seem well soundproofed. Excellent breakfast and were granted a late check out without any problem or charge. Excellent value for money and look forward to returning later this year.

Reviews.Title: “Very central and modern”
Reviews.Author: Dottaz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last week and couldn`t fault it. One of the quietest hotels we have stayed at, 8th floor. Good shower and toiletries, ample breakfast with 2 staff on hand to make sure there was plenty of everything, lovely Spanish ommelette. I missed the view, as the windows in our room were squares of frosted glass, however it was hot sightseeing and wonderful to collapse in a lovely quiet cool room. The majority of guests were young, and the hotel has a hip feel, free Wi-Fi too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rchapman1418
Reviews.Content: I have been to Europe several times. This was one of the larger beds I have had. Very modern, and the shower was great. The staff were very helpful and spoke good English. I would recommend the hotel. Second day was easier to get around once I figured the streets.And of course a Starbucks was close. Email me if you need more info rchapman1418@nwi.net. Randy

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: DREDU
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to metro station and a fex minutes walk to Paseig de Gracia (the champs elysee of Barcelona). The room and bathroom are just perfect. Very very clean with nice shower. Also has free high speed internet in the room. Breakfast is OK, but could be better. Is good enoght for the price we payed. I RECOMEND IT AND WOULD STAY THERE AGAIN.

Reviews.Title: “Great service with a smile”
Reviews.Author: Dutchy070
Reviews.Content: We've have never stayed in a Room mate hotel before, but "Emma" gave us a really pleasant stay in Barcelona. We arrived late in the evening, and we received a warm welcome by Mireille and she provided us with a lot of information about Barcelona, hot spots, restaurants, public transport etc. Great service with a smile! The hotel is modern, clean, good breakfast, nice beds and showers. Wifi was operational and easy access. Metro station very near to hotel, and all "tourist attractions" on walking distance. On the downside; there was no window to open in our room, and there was no sewing(travel)kit available at the reception (or misplaced?) Overall a great stay :-)

Reviews.Title: “Modern & clean!”
Reviews.Author: SuntoryTime
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very modern, clean, and comfortable! The staff was very friendly and helpful, and the breakfast was laid out in a very nice spread/buffet style in the morning until I believe 12pm, for those of us who want to sleep in a little bit! (The breakfast was well worth the extra charge!)

Reviews.Title: “good location to tour the city”
Reviews.Author: Shandonggirl
Reviews.Content: comfortable little hotel and great location. The staffs are very helpful and take time to answer the questions you have. very good breakfast. enough varities, from cheese, to cold cut meat, fresh vegis and fruits. Like the hot patato omolette. wash the restaurant could a little earlier instead of 7, or at least let people to chack out early have access to the room to make some coffee. The only thing we can complain is the room has no window, which we know before we booked the room, and can be little stuffy.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: IngridLuiggi
Reviews.Content: We had a really good time in Barcelona and especially in the Room Mate! Very nice and cool place to stay, friendly staff, good location. I do recomend this place! By the way it´s very nice the idea of giving us the weather in the city at our room when we arrive! Simple idea but shows interesting in the guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent staff, good location!”
Reviews.Author: sofiedb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Roommate Emma for 3 nights, during our citytrip to Barcelona. First of all we found the location to be great... a little bit away from the bussiest part of the Ramblas, but still close enough to walk there in about 15 minutes. The neighborhood is great, many good restaurants, bars and a supermarket nearby. And when you not feel like walking, subway station Diagonal is just a couple of blocks away. Diagonal is at the crossroads of 2 mayor subway lines, that will take you to all the sights in very little time and hardly ever needing to change subway lines. The hotel staff was great! They were friendly, welcoming and great in giving practical tips and directions. I got great advice on how and where to print my concert tickets from the ATM network.. It has been said in earlier reviews, but the staff of this hotel is really outstanding. A question is never too much or too hard for them. Our room had a nice bathroom with a great shower. It didn't have a window, but we didn't mind, as we spend only a few hours in the room to sleep, the rest of the time we are exploring the city. The breakfast buffet had a good choice of breakfast items, for only € 6.00. We only had breakfast there the day we left, the other days we had breakfast in the city. We would definately book this hotel again when returning to Barcelona. For us it is the perfect city hotel at a good price with excellent staff!

Reviews.Title: “Just a great place”
Reviews.Author: Oleg_Ivanov
Reviews.Content: Great, vibrant design. Good service. Big enough and comfortable rooms. Close to metro stations and city center. A lot of good restaurants around. The only disadvantage is that standart rooms does not have the windows facing the street, but have got some sort of its' imitation. For me, it's OK while there's enough fresh air from the conditioning system. But somebody who is afraid of closed spaces, will feel uncomfortable. I know some people who cannot sleep without an open window. And we haven't been warned of this fact before we came. But anyway, I like Emma, and surely will come again next time I visit Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Really decent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: chocolatetwistcone
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights while returning to Barcelona, and before our flight back to canada. We basically were looking for a cheap, decent place to crash and this fit the bill. I call it an "IKEA hotel" because everything is very edgy and modern looking - it was clean, bright, fun (in room surround stereo system!), with a useful and not insanely $ minibar and a decent place to sleep for 2 nights. keep in mind though -The bathroom doesnt have very good sound proofing, so most bodily sounds can be heard easily! But it's clean and well maintained. the Free wifi is awesome as well. the front desk was very helpful in getting us settled and oriented. The only issue we had that although the entire hotel is non smoking, our room smelled faintly of cigarette smoke. The hotel staff was somewhat helpful when asked about this, but unfortunately the hotel was booked up and we were not able to switch rooms, so we dealt with our allergies by staying out of the room as much as possible and then taking medications before going to bed. we unfortunately didnt try out the breakfast (only 6Euros!) which smelled awesome but saw aot of people digging into it before starting their days. The hotel is 3 blocks from Las ramblas de catalunya which eventually gets to the big plaza and then the infamous Las ramblas. Some of the suggestions for food places were clearly quite popular and we were not able to try most of them because of the insanely long lineups. this is a great clean and friendly place to stay for a short visit.

Reviews.Title: “Uber modern, yet felt like home”
Reviews.Author: ellynet
Reviews.Content: Things I wanted out of my hotel in Barcelona that Emma achieved: 1 - Good location, nearby a metro and walking access to some fun spots 2 - Fluffy bed and pillows 3 - Perfect water pressure 4 - A decent hair dryer, for godsakes 5 - Really down-to-earth concierge staff 6 - Good toiletries, love the soap 7 - Really fast and easy to access WiFi (you'd be surprised how many hotels have awful connectivity) 7 - Hot pink rug. This was my first time in Barcelona and all I wanted to do was hang out in my room. BONUS: Satellite radio in the room. I walked in and some deep house music was playing. Needless to say, I left it on the entire 3 nights we stayed. Room Mate Emma is the type of hotel whose branding, service and great taste will make ANYONE a loyal fan. Personally, I will look for a Room Mate hotel anywhere I go from now on. That's how much they impressed me.

Reviews.Title: “Another Room Mate gem”
Reviews.Author: Spencerswood
Reviews.Content: As with all Room Mate hotels there is a pleasant, relaxed atmosphere with very friendly, helpful staff. In reality the rooms are fairly basic but contain everything you need. The cleaning and tidying were immaculate. The Emma got all the simple things right. The funky design just makes it so much more fun than a standard hotel. The location is close to many attractions and metro stations. As others have commented, there is some noise from life outside at night but neither this or the rumble of metro trains disturbed us unduly.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant experience in the heart of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: JavierOS
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a hotel well located for my business trip and I found a place to stay and relax. Sometimes is hard to go away on a business trip as you travel on your own and too many days away from home. However, at the Room Mate Emma I felt really relaxed and confortable. Also, and not less important the hotel give importance to get conscious with the use of water, light, etc. maybe obvious but very important.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value/Good location”
Reviews.Author: Halladay
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and comfortable. Breakfasts were good. Staff were very helpful. Rooms at the front tend to be a little noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Ran a Half marathon and still had time for breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Jamie045
Reviews.Content: REcently visted Barcelona to run the local half marathon. I have stayed in Room mate hotel before and therefore had no hesitation in booking into the Emma. It's a little way out from the centre of Barcelona but very walkable and if your feeling lazy then the Metro is so easy and efficent to use. We were made to feel very welcome from the moment we checked in, and an upgrade was the cherry on top. The room was spacious, very smart and clean and the mini prices very reasonable. The Staff were friendly and very helpful and the breakfast although only continental were superb, very fresh and lots to choice from and because they don't do evening meals serve until 12 o'clock. Which mean't after I had completed my half marathon we had time to get back and have breakfast. Perfect trip made all the more special by staying at the Emma.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic trendy hotel”
Reviews.Author: duttoa
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at one of the Room Mate hotels in Madrid had no hesitation on booking Room Mate Emma. The hotel lived up to its description on Room Mates website and we were thrilled with its location. We had booked a deluxe room which we were pleased with but were unsure what we had paid extra for compared to a standard room. The breakfast which is served until 12 noon is fantastic, and the choice and quality couldn't be faulted. The staff were friendly and spoke very good English and advised of lots of interesting places to visit and eat at .

Reviews.Title: “good choice”
Reviews.Author: glrothman
Reviews.Content: After endlessly searching the web for a good hotel in Barcelona, we finally settled on this rather youth oriented hotel. They offered a reasonable rate, paid upon departure, allowing no fees for cancels, with wifi and breakfast. This nicely avoids having to rely on Expedia or any other pay up front service. This is a very cool hotel. The interior is very bright and modern. The rooms are a bit tight, but done very well, with colorful panels, and very modern touches. Definitely the best shower I have taken in Europe, with nice big shower stalls, and lots of hot water. The breakfast is great, and a nice bargain to boot. The staff was incredibly helpful, offering ideas for every question. We were given a gratis upgrade to a superior room overlooking the street, which offers plenty of light, along with a fair amount of street noise. Still its not unbearable. We had thought that the place to be was on or near Las Ramblas...actually, this location is lots more attractive, with less street traffic, less noise, great nearby eateries, and either a 15 minute walk or one metro stop to Las Ramblas. it is only a couple of blocks to two of Gaudis most famous apartment buildings, and the 5th avenue of Barcelona. The main problems are low lighting in the rooms, which is only an issue when you are trying to find something that you have misplaced, and the potential street noise in the front rooms which overlook the street. All in all, a good deal, nice looks, good location, good staff, excellent wifi, wonderful shower, and lots of apples!!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy budget option in a good location. Air freshener overload though! Would not return.”
Reviews.Author: Tigs1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night in Jan. Location is great. The room was a decent size and clean. Bed was comfortable. Staff seemed very helpful. Suspect noise would have been a problem if we were staying longer- had a room on 5th floor - heard/felt the Metro at that height. Would have kept us awake if we were trying to sleep throuh it but we were leaving at 6 a.m. so it was a handy wake up call. The fittings and fixtures are very cheap and already showing wear and tear - surprising for a such a new hotel. Main negative (apart from noise) was the hideous and very pungent air freshener smell in the room. No way to air it out as no window. This was really the main negative. Enough to put me off though - really was pungent!!!

Reviews.Title: “Style, charm and good location”
Reviews.Author: ebrundown
Reviews.Content: I like the Room Mate hotels -- I've stayed at the Alicia and the Oscar in Madrid -- so I knew what to expect. The Emma is consistent in style with the others, as it is designed by the same guy, but it seemed a little calmer, less intent on trying to overwhelm me with hipness than some of the others in this chain. My room looked out onto an inner courtyard, which made it completely silent at night, even on New Year's Eve. The staff were always friendly and helpful, and the buffet breakfast was terrific. The location is also fantastic -- close to everything in the Eixample and not far from anything else in Barcelona. There's a metro stop less than a block away! No complaints!

Reviews.Title: “Groovy design with super comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: pimples
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because it has an ideal location (it's on the same street with Casa Mila) and we got more than we expected. The hotel is new so it smells, looks and is very clean. The double rooms are spacious and the beds are very comfortable (one of the best sleeps ever). The groovy swirly designs on the walls and the sexy bathroom could result a bit perplexing or too clublike for the older generation but we find it ok, as it is also smartly conserving energy (the light in the shower provides light for the bed area too). The breakfast is simple but ok (better than other Roommates we had been to) and the staff is super helpful. The only thing we didn't like was that the check out bill included a breakfast we didn't have. If that had not happen and makes us wonder if the hotel's computer is intentionally cheating on us, we would have given this hotel full marks.

Reviews.Title: “Great room and location”
Reviews.Author: facls
Reviews.Content: My and wife and I stayed here for 8 days in November. We had a Deluxe room, good space for us and our luggage. The shower is quite good, as is the bed. We stayed in the 6th floor, and could hear the noise on the streets from nearby bars. Nothing that could prevent us from sleeping, though. They offer free wi-fi, which worked perfectly from the very first day, strong signal and quick access. There is also a laptop on the lobby which offers free access to the internet. The staff was also very helpful throughout our stay. The location is great, a couple of blocks from the Metro, a ten minute walk to Passeig de Gracia, La Pedrera and Casa Battlo. There are some good restaurants in the area as well, and great places for breakfast. I recommend El Fornet, also on Carrer Rossello, great sandwiches and desserts!

Reviews.Title: “No frills, interesting decor. Friendly, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Morgan2010
Reviews.Content: Our first time staying at a Room Mate hotel. Do not if they are all like this one. Decor was a all white - kind of like Ikea furniture. But it was clean, and quiet. Just want we like in a hotel in a city. Rates differ by date.

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect”
Reviews.Author: lgiusti
Reviews.Content: Downtwon is at a walkable distance. People are very friendly and helpful. Brand new rooms, no noise at night. Just perfect for a weekend in Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Too Many Vibes”
Reviews.Author: agl120854
Reviews.Content: I would strongly recommend the hotel as it is a fantastic value in an excellent in Barcelona. Very convenient, 2 blocks from major Metro exchange with access to the entire city and walkable everywhere. Many top Barcelona restaurants are also with a few blocks of the hotel. Rooms were bright and clean. We were upgraded to a superior room, from a standard but unfortunately it was on the first floor and there was a perpetual bass permeating through the room from the lobby music. Also as pointed out by other reviewers you do feel the subway vibes through the room but it was not a problem for sleeping. The front desk staff were extremely helpful and friendly. Our rate included breakfast which as a continental breakfast was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money hotel...Enjoy.”
Reviews.Author: woodlark1
Reviews.Content: On arrival our room was upgraded, the room was plenty large enough and very clean. The staff were very friendly/helpful. I read reviews about the decor being cheap (this is not a 5 star hotel) the decor was funky and a little different. The bed was extra comfy especially with the large pillows. Shower loads of pressure. Breakfast continental and all fresh. Metro nearby (Tip 1......buy a T10 ticket 7.95e gets you ten metro trips for half the price) (Tip 2....when catching shuttle bus to airport beware there are 2 terminals)

Reviews.Title: “Trendy Hotel, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: HKFoodie
Reviews.Content: This is typical room mate hotel with trendy interior (hope you like purple). The rooms are average size. Wifi in rooms was great. Location is slightly outside old city of Barcelona which is around 15 min. walk to start of the pedestrian streets. However the hotel is next to a couple of metro lines so it is convenient to use metro. No hotel parking (in process) but there is a garage down the street you can park for Euro 24 per day.

Reviews.Title: “Full of Ambiance & Good Vibes”
Reviews.Author: wanderingexpat
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here as part of our honeymoon tour and they were the best. Staff was helpful and friendly, room was not only clean but smelled lovely, and the toiletries are high quality. We got the cheapest room and booked far enough in advance that it was well under €100 per night - not including breakfast (but there are plenty of cafes nearby). The room was small but big for us (we live in a studio) and we didn't mind that the 'window' is a wall of glass bricks. We arrived at 9 am following a red eye flight and we were happy to draw the curtains and sleep in peace and quiet until the afternoon. As is common in Europe, our double room didn't have a double bed but 2 smaller ones pushed together. It seems that they do have rooms with a double bed and they told us to check the next day to see if one was available but the next day we heard them giving that speech to another couple - so if you really want one I suppose you'll need to request in advance. Still, we were just so glad to be able to check-in at 9am! We took the airbus from the airport and switched to the subway at Plaza Catalunya to Diagonal. But if you're dead tired from traveling then it might be worth it to take a cab from the Plaza. If you're not too tired, it's only about a 10 minute walk from the Plaza. The hotel is in a great location and we walked or took the subway everywhere, but I would suggest bikes if you're up to it. We loved this hotel - from music in the rooms to free apples, it was everything we needed!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel with very good service”
Reviews.Author: M_K2009Hasselt
Reviews.Content: As we had very good experiences with Room Mate Lola in Malaga, we decided whenever we would go back to Spain we would try to book a Room Mate hotel. So, we booked the Room Mate Emma in Barcelona and - once more - it was worth every cent! Due to a strike our flight was delayed with 1 day. Although we were not able to inform the hotel before, they did not charge us this night! Rooms are in the typical Room Mate style : trendy and modern. Service is very good and breakfast is more than ok! One minor disadvantage : the metro is running beneath the hotel, but this is not very disturbing

Reviews.Title: “Funky, Trendy, Hip & Cool”
Reviews.Author: neil6534
Reviews.Content: Room Mate Emma is a fab boutique hotel which is very appealing if you are into up to date hotels, however there is nothing pretentious about the staff, just very helpful and friendly. I won’t repeat what previous reviews have said but I will back all the good ones up. The only thing that was missing was some fruit at breakfast and a kettle in room to make tea or coffee. This is ok if you can order room service but you can’t. We made sure we turned down the temperature of the room so when we came back from a busy day in the heat we had a lovely cool room to come back to (magical!!) Its great you have that option, they have really thought about attention to detail. Things to notes; • The hotel is not far from the main town and the nearest Metro stop is Provenca • If going with a friend the shower door is clear glass and toilet door is frosted glass, so very intimate. • Watch out for an extra % (20 generally) for sitting outside restaurants. • Pickpockets on the metro but you need to take that into account for any main city. This aside the architecture is amazing and gives the city an edge that pulls in the crowds day after day thanks to Gaudi and Lluis Domenech I Montaner. • You can buy a travel card for your whole stay – 4 days = 37euros, this gives you discounts off certain tourist attractions but we found buying a daily ticket at 6euros a day suited us – can be used on all public transport. Recommended sights Magic fountains – Must see and its free, 9pm-11pm every night. Nearest metro Espanya.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean rooms, great price and service”
Reviews.Author: onescoop
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location for bars, restaurants and shops away from the more touristy part of Barcelona. Service is great, the rooms are simple but clean and well decorated with aircon.

Reviews.Title: “My best birthday ever”
Reviews.Author: pat_arruda
Reviews.Content: I went to Barcelona for 3 days to celebrate my birthday with my love and my friends, and by luck, snooping around on the web, I found this trendy low-cost-design hotel. Well lucky me... The price is really fair for what you get. It's all brand new, the bed is comfy, the long-pillows too, the shower is huge, the room is fully equipped, good amenities. There is a music system in the room where you can connect you ipod or choose between many different stations: lounge music is the best. The breakfast is light (no eggs and grassy foods), but with a big variety of things. The staff is always available, they speak many different languages, and are willing to help you. For my birthday they left me in the room some cookies and a sweet note, and they all wished me a happy birthday. Sweet! :) And plus: great location. Barcelona is a big city, but the hotel is very central and there's a subway station around the corner. Ohh by the way, there's a small restaurant near the hotel where they do only hamburgers: home-made, juicy, delicious. Sometimes you might have to wait a bit to get a table. Sorry but I cant remember the name now... If I ever go back to BCN I will surely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, but more excellent personnel!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mlkatsiki
Reviews.Content: I travelled in July 2010, in Barcelona with a friend, and we chosed through Booking.com the RoomMate Emma!!!!! First of all it is a very very nice and design boutique hotel and best of all it isn't expensive!!!! Although we went at 10.00 in the morning they had our room ready (even though the check-in is at 2.00pm) !!!!!, so it was so good for us after a night of travelling to have the opportunity to rest before starting exploring the town!!!!! the breakfast is excellent and its price of 6euro is nothing compared to the choices the buffet has!!!! The rooms are very beautiful, and the only thing I have to say is that it was a little inconvinient the fact that the shower's door was from glass, and the fact that if someone wanted to read he had to switch on both the lightsby the beds!!! however, the beds were very comfortable, and I really would like to have one of their pillows in my bed!!!! the gadget in the wall with the music and the e-radio was very nice, and the flat TV on the wall was good!!!!! But the best of all that this hotel has to offer is the personnel!!!! Indeed, although I have travelled, and stayed in many hotels all over Europe, and New York, the employees of RoomMate Emma cannot be compared with anyone!!!!!It was really an unexpected surprise to meet such good persons, who were ready at any time to help you with everything!!!!! We really owe to them, some very good and not expensive gourmet experiences, and good tips about Barcelona!!!!! some tips for Barcelona: don't try to eat anywhere near The Rambla, all the restaurants there are very expensive and the the quality of the food is very very poor....... Oscar and Felippe from the Room Mate Emma reccomended us some very very good restaurants (and they had even the courtesy to print the maps of their location for us, and even to make a reservation in one of them!!!!!) try the Cerveceria Cataluna and the Baltazar, they both are in a walking distance from the hotel, the food there is excellent, and the prices really value for money!!!!! If you want to visit Gaudi's building I would strongly reccomend to go first of all and have an inhouse visit(12euros) in the casa Batllo, and then to La Perdera, but if you want to go to La Sagrada Familia, don't bother to go inside.....the best view is from outside and it doesn't worth almost the 20 euros you ll have to spend in order to go inside and to see nothing more than a construction place.....All the things that you need to know are more than enough in the 2 casas I mentioned before finally I really liked Barcelona, but I need to admitt that staying in this hotel, made my vacations really good, and to add that if I ever go back to Barcelona definetely I will stay in Room Mate Emma but also that whereever I ll go and there is a Room Mate hotel, it will definetely be my first choice!!!!!!! A huge thanks to all the people that work there

Reviews.Title: “great location!”
Reviews.Author: islandervne
Reviews.Content: we stayed in emma for our first visit to barelona and had a regular double room and a delux double room (with an extra bed; supplementary charge of 50euros). in the end, i think it would've probably been better if we had just gotten 3 regular rooms but it was to late to switch. but let me tell you that this was the most comfortable extra bed i have slept on in a hotel room. they actually brought in a real bed and not a fold out. haha. Take the Aerobus from barcelona airport and get out at plaza de catalunya (i think it's the 4th stop but it's very clear on the bus which one it is). from here, you can either walk the 20 odd minutes or ride the metro L3 from catalunya to diagonal (towards trinitat nova), get out and walk the two blocks. There is an INFO center underneath plaza catalunya where you can ask for info and maps and they can give you directions...but there is usually a line down there. the location is super convenient as it is very close to the metro stops: Provenca and Diagonal. It is about a 20 minute walk from Plaza Catalunya (sorry, i cant figure out how to make those c squiggly signs on my computer). there is a laundromat about a 10 minute walk away (large safe streets towards shopping area) and a "supermercat" 3 minutes away. there is also an english bookstore (COME IN) on the same block which carries guidebooks! i didnt have their breakfast, but i can definitely recommend PAUL (satellite location of french bakery) which is on calle rossello between the hotel and gracia (Calle Rosellon 235) on the left side as you're walking towards gracia. also, for those who are interested, the hop on/hop off touristic bus has a stop very close stop to the hotel at La Padrera on both the blue and red lines. the rooms were small, compared to the places we stayed at in other cities, but it was a good deal for the price we paid. The aesthetics of the interior decor is...young...and tries very hard. haha. reminds me a lot of D2 hotel in chiang mai... the double room had a bathroom without a door and a glass door to the shower so just heads up in case you're shacking up with someone you're not too comfortable with. lol. the staff was very nice and helpful and answered our many questions.

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: kebmo2
Reviews.Content: Great room... Cleverly decorated... Stylish... Affordable... Centrally located... Love the Room-mate Emma!! Room was a little small, but who cares? It was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with great staff and good location”
Reviews.Author: Lumgigi
Reviews.Content: room is tidy and clean, good location to major sightseeing points close to subway station only 3mins walking distance helpful and friendly staff

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly formed”
Reviews.Author: Noodlefish
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in Room Mate Laura in Madrid, I was interested to try out the new Room Mate Emma in Barcelona. The rooms are the size you would expect from a city hotel in Europe, not tiny, but not large either. The staff where very helpful, and spoke English as well as Spanish (and probably more but I had no cause to find out) There is access to a PC in reception if you do not have your own pc. The Breakfast was plentiful and ran to a very respectable Midday. Emma is located near to Diagonal, and surrounded by many good cafes and restaurants. I would definitely stay again if I am in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “TRENDY!”
Reviews.Author: sujamas
Reviews.Content: Room Mate Emma! is a modern and trendy hotel full with new designs, lights ,very modern such as music system is on the wall. The room mate emma is a small boutique hotel on the small road behind the big shopping streets and noises, the room is small just for 2 peoples but you go to Barcelona for outside actions , bathroom is medium size and comfortable . Nice and Great services !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay.”
Reviews.Author: Beto_BR
Reviews.Content: Very courteous staff, oustanding location, clean and silent rooms although somewhat small. Excellent breakfast up to 12 noon. Very good value for a short stay, little expensive if one is to stay for a full week.

HotelInfo.Name: Room Mate Emma
HotelInfo.Address: Carrer Rossello 205 | Eixample, 08008 Barcelona, Spain
